intro: Chuquiraga insignis, commonly known as the Andean chia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that are often clustered in spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are typically alternate, hairy, and have a rough texture. Chuquiraga insignis is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in cool, temperate climates.
